block.p: Samantha Stewart Skey, the daughter of Sally Reed Skey and W. S. Gerald Skey of Princeton, N.J., was married yesterday to Dr. Gregory Clifford Dillon, a son of Monika and Brian Dillon of New York. The Rev. Daphne Hawkes performed the Episcopal ceremony at Trinity Church in Princeton.

Ms. Skey, 28, is keeping her name. She is the vice president for sales at Alloy Online, a company in New York that operates Alloy.com, a Web site for teenagers. She graduated from Hamilton College. Her father is a partner in Skey, Dumont & Matejek, a Princeton law firm. Her mother teaches science at the Pennington School in Pennington, N.J.

Samantha Stewart Skey, the daughter of Sally Reed Skey and W. S. Gerald Skey of Princeton, N.J., was married yesterday to Dr. Gregory Clifford Dillon, a son of Monika and Brian Dillon of New York. The Rev. Daphne Hawkes performed the Episcopal ceremony at Trinity Church in Princeton.

Ms. Skey, 28, is keeping her name. She is the vice president for sales at Alloy Online, a company in New York that operates Alloy.com, a Web site for teenagers. She graduated from Hamilton College. Her father is a partner in Skey, Dumont & Matejek, a Princeton law firm. Her mother teaches science at the Pennington School in Pennington, N.J.

Dr. Dillon, 32, is a resident in psychiatry at the Weill Cornell Center of New York Presbyterian Hospital. He graduated from Brown University and received his medical degree from the University of Pennsylvania.

The bridegroom's mother is the director of development at the Museum of Modern Art in New York, where she oversees fund-raising. His father, who retired as an associate creative director and senior vice president from Young & Rubicam, the New York advertising agency, is a fiction writer.
